fee_codes.description: Evenings (17:00h – 24:00h) Monday to Friday or daytime and evenings on Saturdays, Sundays or Holidays - increase the total anaesthetic fee by
Nights (00:00h – 07:00h) - increase the total anaesthetic fee by
Evenings (17:00h - 24:00h) Monday to Friday; or for non-elective surgery with sacrifice of office hours - Weekdays
fee_codes.conditions: Eligible for payment only for the first patient seen on each special visit.

fee_codes.description: Saturdays, Sundays or Holidays daytime and evenings (07:00h - 24:00h)
fee_codes.conditions: Eligible for payment only for the first patient seen on each special visit.
Eligible for payment only for the first patient seen on each special visit.

fee_codes.description: When an anaesthetic has begun but the operation is cancelled prior to commencement of surgery.
Service provided by the second anaesthesiologist when necessary.
Service provided by the replacement anaesthesiologist during a surgical procedure.
fee_codes.conditions: Qualifies for the premiums E400C or E401C only if the case commences after hours.

fee_codes.description: Introduction of a catheter for labour analgesia, including the first dose of medication with or without any combined spinal-epidural injection(s).
Time units for maintenance of obstetrical epidural anaesthesia.
fee_codes.fee: 1 unit for each ½ hour of time to a maximum of 12 units.

fee_codes.description: Time units for attendance at delivery.
fee_codes.fee: 4 base units and 1 unit for each ¼ hour.

rules: The amount payable for the anaesthesia service is calculated by adding the number of basic and time units and multiplying the total by the anaesthesiologist unit fee.
Claims for anaesthesia services rendered with a surgical procedure should use the suffix 'C' with the procedural code.
notes: All references to an anaesthesiologist in this Schedule are references to any physician providing anaesthetic services.
General anaesthesia includes all forms of anaesthesia except local infiltration, unless otherwise specifically listed.
